channel.title: Permitted?
channel.description:
Is it permitted to delete other people topics without notice or reports? It happens to often people wonder where their command/topics went. Just recently I asked for a special RSC related website, I asked for the source code or at-least the registration code.
Today the topic was suddenly gone.

item.title: Permitted?
item.dc:creator: @uberpk3r uberpk3r
item.description:
@uberpk3r wrote:

Owell keep the ignorance at top then, keep the forum un-modern if the people to stupid to realize that it doesn’t hurt with improvement/tweaks/community suggestion that thats all I have to say. probleblay no

Read full topic

item.title: Permitted?
item.dc:creator: @B2300_T4nk B2300 T4nk
item.description:
@B2300_T4nk wrote:

You idiot. Did you ever open the locked topics? Most of them are RS2 Adverts.

Read full topic

item.title: Permitted?
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Your username kind of proves otherwise to be honest. The fact of the matter is and it was stated before that a moderator is well aware of what can and should be done, all decisions that are made on this forum is at their own discretion. If an administrator thinks otherwise and doesn’t feel that the moderator is doing a good job, he/she will consult with that moderator, otherwise it doesn’t matter what someone says because he/she isn’t suppose to argue with the staff team.

The RSC section isn’t moderated THAT much by the moderators except the sectional/global moderators of that board and therefore it honestly depends on what they think to do with the board. Just because that board is treated a little differently because of moderator(s); xEnt and Peeter think to do with the board doesn’t mean the rest of them are treated the same.

Of course your suggestion is ignored because as Miss Silabsoft said; “Every so often someone makes a thread like this and guess what happens? Nothing, because nothing is wrong with the moderation team to begin with.”

Read full topic

item.title: Permitted?
item.dc:creator: @uberpk3r uberpk3r
item.description:
@uberpk3r wrote:

[quote="`SJ_, post:16, topic:393965"]As Si Force said, moderators take action at their own discretion. We do what we have to, to keep the peace on the forums. If we didn’t do anything at all, the forum would be exactly like it was a few months ago.

Edit:
Oh, at your “lame-easy-deletion” snide comment, we delete unneeded topics to keep the forum clean. Do we really want to see a bunch of locked topics in one board?[/quote]

Thats not fair to say because when I look at the RSCAdvertise section I see a bunch of locked topics (http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,119.0.html) The topics that are locked are RS2 advertisements.
So what you mean is that When I simple advertise my Clean server which is a RSC base, I get deleted BUT when someone advertise RS2 server there they simply get locked ?
The arguments you do does not make sense.

@ Si Force, You have done a great job moderating(RSC section), But All I’m saying you people have flaws and All I ask to simple stop deleting topics because it doesn’t make sense.

And I’m 21 years old perhaps I do not always act like it, but can you blame me? I’m sitting on a forum where more then 50%(I think) of the people are under 15.

Actually do you know what, I don’t care its a baby forum where the mods don’t even listen to simple suggestion on how to make it a better place, you don’t even read what i’m saying. You calling me 11 by looking at my previous posts yet you are to stubborn to take simple suggestion. Since the mods are little older here I thought they would atleast moderate, act, listen without crying a river. good luck with the forum.

Read full topic

item.title: Permitted?
item.dc:creator: @k_a_h_leader Aeolian
item.description:
@k_a_h_leader wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

You should know by now that the forums have been ran the same way for years without problems. Every so often someone makes a thread like this and guess what happens? Nothing, because nothing is wrong with the moderation team to begin with. The last time this forum has had any serious moderator issues was in 2008.

Couldn’t be more right.

Read full topic

item.title: Permitted?
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

As Si Force said, moderators take action at their own discretion. We do what we have to, to keep the peace on the forums. If we didn’t do anything at all, the forum would be exactly like it was a few months ago.

Edit:
Oh, at your “lame-easy-deletion” snide comment, we delete unneeded topics to keep the forum clean. Do we really want to see a bunch of locked topics in one board?

Read full topic

item.title: Permitted?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

The moderators keep the peace everyday. I don’t know where you’re going to as you’re original message was complaining about a sudden deletion of your topic, and you’re talking about keeping the peace now. All moderators can moderate at their own discretion and are more than capable at making their own decisions.

If you actually took a step back and looked you’d find that you’re the only one stepping out of order here, from my point of view anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Permitted?
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

You may have been here for “2-3 years”, but your post history is of absolutely no value. So, with that, I would say you DON’T actually have the ‘rights to speak’. If you really are 21, you sure do need to grow up. Just reading your posts, I’d say you were more near 11.

Read full topic

item.title: Permitted?

item.title: Permitted?
item.dc:creator: @uberpk3r uberpk3r
item.description:
@uberpk3r wrote:

[quote="`SJ_, post:11, topic:393965"][quote author=uberpk3r link=topic=491149.msg3592481#msg3592481 date=1304763176]

I don’t know much about the moderation system since I’m not a moderator. Though when the thread is deleted it’s for a purpose, sometimes the moderator that deletes the thread makes a mistake sometimes. The thread has to have some sort of reason for being deleted and in the case of being deleted, their not required to send someone a message stating the thread is being deleted.

Correct me if I’m wrong.

You’re 100% correct.

Not 100% correct, since 2-3 of my threads got deleted for people reported it as a virus when it was 100% clean.
I’m not here to make friends therefor I don’t care if some of the community dislike me. All I ask to moderate better.

Don’t randomly delete, lock it and add some “warning text”
Don’t go with he first person who report a topic/thread. make some research scan it or whatever.¨
Put some work into moderating otherwise you are not the person this forum needs.

Its actually common sense otherwise who have we else to relay on other then a moderator .

Oh and here an example where someone moderated bad.

I made a post asked for certain www files, next day the topic is gone. what I can think of is that the owner "peeter - RSC moderator " of the website didn’t want the topic there, therefor he deleted it.

Fair?

  • yes, DEAL WITH IT
  • Why do you lie ?

[/quote]
You need to stop being such a little girl and deal with it. And actually I had over 4 people reporting your thread as a virus, you’re lucky I didn’t take further action on you.[/quote]

Actually I’m not lucky because someone else did delete it(Also said do a research or a scan before). As I said before “Its a community forum” shouldn’t the mods do everything to keep order in this forum?

I know there some small kids around here which makes it hard to be serious but I’m 21 years old and would like to see some more grown up actions and not these lame-easy-deletion of topics.

@ Ix Soulcist xI,
I’m not complaining, simply want some order into this forum, I don’t believe the admins want a forum where to mods don’t care? Why have a forum if its like this?

I been here for 2-3 years I think I have the rights to speak.

Read full topic

    You need to stop being such a little girl and deal with it. And actually I had over 4 people reporting your thread as a virus, you’re lucky I didn’t take further action on you.

item.title: Permitted?
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Your not allowed to consult how bad a moderator is doing. Instead, your suppose to consult the moderator VIA private messaging or contact an administrator. You also must know that the member’s aren’t allowed to complain about the moderator’s action.

That is the reason for the member for him/she should private message an administrator and don’t create a thread about it.

Read full topic

Its mostly a suggestion since its a community forum
